name: Thirumalirunjolai
thirukkolam: Standing posture along with Sridevi, Bhoodevi, and the five weapons (Panchayudha) including the Prayoga Chakra.
theertham: Noopura Gangai, also known as Silambaru.

festivals.name: Chithirai Pournami Festival
festivals.description: The festival where the Lord departs for Madurai to witness the wedding of his sister, Meenakshi.

notes: There is a belief that every night at midnight, Lord Yama (God of Death) visits this shrine to worship Lord Alagar.

name: Srivilliputhur
thirukkolam: Vatapatra Sayanam (Reclining on a banyan leaf)
mangalasasanam: Both Periyazhwar and Sri Andal; 2 Pasurams (hymns)

festivals.name: Thiruppavai Month
festivals.description: The thirty Thiruppavai hymns composed by Sri Andal are recited along with lullabies.

festivals.name: Andal Jayanthi
festivals.description: The birth star of Andal (Pooram) is celebrated grandly.

festivals.name: Brahmotsavam
festivals.description: On the 5th day, the Five Perumals appear in the Garuda Seva, and on the 9th day, the Chariot Festival (Ther) takes place.

notes: The temple tower (Gopuram) is 164 feet high and is the official emblem of the Tamil Nadu government.
The idol of Lakshmi Narayanan, worshipped by Periyazhwar during his lifetime, is kept and worshipped in a separate shrine today.

name: Thirukkoodal
theertham: Chakra Theertham, Krithamala River, Vaigai River

festivals.name: Garuda Seva
festivals.description: Garuda Seva on the full moon day.

festivals.name: Sayana Festival
festivals.description: Sayana festival and Mukkani (three fruits) festival.

festivals.name: Ennai Kappu
festivals.description: Oil abhishekam festival.

festivals.name: Periyazhwar Festival
festivals.description: Ten-day festival during the Swathi star. This is the place where Periyazhwar sang the "Thirupallandu".

festivals.name: Navaratri
festivals.description: The Navaratri festival is celebrated grandly.

notes: Among 96 types of Vimanams, the first and most magnificent is the Ashtanga Vimanam.
Koodalazhagar is the Lord who gives darsan (Sevai) across the four Yugas.
This is the place where Periyazhwar sang the "Thirupallandu" (sacred hymn).

name: Thiruvaramangai
thirukkolam: Coronation posture (Pattabhisheka Thirukkolam), sitting with two consorts.
vimanam: Sri Vaikunda Vimanam (also known as Nanda-varthana Vimanam)
witnesses: Brahma, Indra, Romasa Maharishi, Bhrigu Maharishi, Markandeya, Garuda, Urvashi, Tilottama, and the King of Sindhu.

festivals.name: Brahmotsavam (Chithirai)
festivals.description: Brahmotsavam celebrated grandly.

festivals.name: Brahmotsavam (Panguni)
festivals.description: Brahmotsavam celebrated grandly.

festivals.name: Ennai Kappu
festivals.description: A special oil abhishekam is performed using one "kottai" (a large measure) of oil. The oil is collected in a well and sold to devotees, as it is considered a medicinal cure for diseases.

festivals.name: Lakh Deepam
festivals.description: Once every 6 years, one lakh (100,000) lamps are lit in the temple.

notes: The oil used for the Ennai Kappu ceremony is collected in a well and sold to devotees, as it is considered a medicinal cure for diseases.

name: Thirukkurugur
witnesses: Brahma, Nammazhwar, Sangadu Thandan, Rishis, Madhurakavi Azhwar.

festivals.name: Nammazhwar Jayanthi
festivals.description: This is the birthplace of Nammazhwar. Chariot festival and Theerthavari are held on his birth star.

festivals.name: Nava Tirupathi Garuda Seva
festivals.description: The deities of the 9 nearby Divya Desams arrive on Garuda mounts to visit Azhwar Thirunagari.

notes: There is a musical stone Nadaswaram (stone pipe) carved from rock at this site.
The statues of Nammazhwar, Ramanuja, and the Vigraham (deity) made by boiling water (Thamirabarani) are located here.

festivals.name: Pagal Pathu
festivals.description: Ten-day festival during the day.

festivals.name: Ra Pathu
festivals.description: Ten-day night festival. On the 10th day, it is believed that Nammazhwar attains Moksha.

festivals.name: Vaikunda Ekadasi
festivals.description: The Lord provides darsan through the Paramapada Vaasal (gateway to heaven) adorned in the Ratna Angi (gem-studded armor).

name: Nachiyar Koil
thirukkolam: Standing posture, appearing as if marrying the Goddess.

festivals.name: Kal Garuda Seva (Margazhi)
festivals.description: The Kal Garuda (Stone Garuda) vehicle service on the 4th day of Brahmotsavam. Garuda is adorned with eight snakes as ornaments.

festivals.name: Kal Garuda Seva (Panguni)
festivals.description: The Kal Garuda vehicle service on the 4th day of Brahmotsavam.

notes: Only 4 people carry the vehicle from the sanctum. As it moves out, its weight increases, requiring 16 people, then 32 people at the next circuit, and finally 64 people to carry it.

name: Thirukkudanthai
thirukkolam: Reclining posture; the posture of slightly raising the body while supporting it with the hands. Known as Utthana Sayana posture.

festivals.name: Kumbh Mela
festivals.description: When Jupiter enters the Aquarius (Kumba) zodiac sign, Kumbh Mela is celebrated.

festivals.name: Chariot Festival
festivals.description: Grand chariot festival.

notes: In this temple, the main sanctum (Garbhagriha) of the Lord is designed in the shape of a chariot with four wheels, as if pulled by horses. It is constructed entirely of granite.

name: Thirukkacchi Athigiri
theertham: Sri Anantha Saras Theertham (Sri Athigiri Varadar resides within this sacred water)
mangalasasanam: Hymns sung by Boothathalvar, Peyalvar, and Thirumalisai Alvar; a total of 7 Pasurams (verses)
witnesses: Brahma, Bhrigu Muni, Gajendran, Brihaspati, Adiseshan, King Citra, and Saraswati

festivals.name: Garuda Seva
festivals.description: Sri Varadharaja Perumal appears on the Garuda Vahana (mount) on the 3rd day of Brahmotsavam.

notes: There are 14 Divya Desams in the city of Kanchi.
Kanchi is a city where the sound of the Vedas is constantly heard throughout the Divya Desam.

name: Manimada Kovil

festivals.name: 11 Garuda Seva
festivals.description: The deities of the 11 Divya Desams assemble at a pandal in front of Manimada Kovil. Thirumangai Alvar performs Mangalasasanam for each deity. The 11 Divya Desam deities then process through the streets on Garuda Vahana.

notes: The 11 Divya Desams are situated within a 4 km radius.
